context: Meta is the largest social media company globally with nearly 4 billion monthly active users across its Family of Apps (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp). In Q1 2025, Meta reported EPS of $6.43 (exceeding $5.33 estimate) and revenue of $42.31B (up 16.1% YoY). The company plans $60-65B in capital expenditures for 2025, primarily for AI development including a large-scale AI data center. Meta captures 63.8% of global social media ad spend in H1 2024. The broader metaverse market is projected to reach $203.7B by 2025. Meta has a favorable debt-to-equity ratio of 0.26 compared to top peers.

competitors.name: Google / Alphabet
competitors.notes: Primary competitor in digital advertising market. Competes for ad spend and user attention across platforms.

competitors.name: Snap Inc.
competitors.notes: Visual content and AR competitor. Focus on younger demographics similar to Instagram user base. Innovations in augmented reality present competitive challenge.

competitors.name: Pinterest
competitors.notes: Visual discovery and social media competitor, particularly in lifestyle and shopping categories.

competitors.name: Reddit
competitors.notes: Social media and community platform competitor for user engagement and advertising revenue.

competitors.name: Amazon
competitors.notes: Competitor in digital advertising market, growing ad business threatens Meta's revenue.

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Competes in digital advertising and business communication tools.

competitors.name: ByteDance / TikTok
competitors.notes: Major social media competitor, particularly strong with younger users. Competes directly with Instagram Reels.

competitors.name: Apple iMessage
competitors.notes: Messaging competitor to WhatsApp. Integration within Apple ecosystem and privacy focus attracts users concerned about data security.

competitors.name: Telegram
competitors.notes: Encrypted messaging service alternative to WhatsApp. Appeals to privacy-focused users with end-to-end encryption.

competitors.name: Signal
competitors.notes: Privacy-focused messaging app competing with WhatsApp on security and encryption features.

competitors.name: Apple (Vision Pro)
competitors.notes: VR/AR competitor with mixed reality headsets and spatial computing devices.

competitors.name: ByteDance (Pico VR)
competitors.notes: Direct VR headset competitor, particularly strong in Asian markets.

competitors.name: HTC (Vive)
competitors.notes: VR headset and ecosystem competitor in virtual reality space.

competitors.name: Microsoft (HoloLens)
competitors.notes: AR/VR and mixed reality platform competitor, focused on enterprise applications.

competitors.name: Sony (PlayStation VR)
competitors.notes: VR headset competitor focused on gaming and entertainment.

competitors.name: Valve (Index VR)
competitors.notes: VR headset and SteamVR platform competitor in gaming-focused VR market.
